description_en: A female full sibling that developed from a shared ovum.
A male full sibling that developed from a shared ovum.
A female progeny with genetic makeup inherited from the parent.
A female relative who is the biological mother of the biological father.

value_en: Half-brother with Mother as Common Parent
description_en: A male sibling who shares the genetic makeup inherited from only the biological mother.
description_code: Half-brother with Mother as Common Parent

description_en: A child of one's grandchild.
A female child of one's niece or nephew.

value_en: Half-brother with Father as Common Parent
description_en: A male sibling who shares the genetic makeup inherited from only the biological father.
description_code: Half-brother with Father as Common Parent

description_en: A male progeny with genetic makeup inherited from the parent.
A female who shares with her sibling the genetic makeup inherited from both of the biological parents.
A relative who is the offspring of a sibling of the biological mother and thus sharing a common ancestor.
A female relative who is the biological mother of the biological mother.
A male grandchild.
A son of your brother or sister.
The uncle of one's father.
A relative who is the offspring of a sibling of the biological father and thus sharing a common ancestor.
A male full sibling that developed from a separately fertilized ova during the same pregnancy.
A parent of one's maternal grandparent.
A male who contributes to the genetic makeup of his offspring through the fertilization of an ovum by his sperm.
A female relative who is a sibling of the biological father, and who both share a common ancestor.
A male who shares with his sibling the genetic makeup inherited from both of the biological parents.
The uncle of one's mother.
A male relative who is the biological father of the biological mother.
A male child of one's niece or nephew.
A female relative who is a sibling of the biological mother, and who both share a common ancestor.
A male relative who is a sibling of the biological father, and who both share a common ancestor.
Someone deriving or descending from an ancestor.

value_en: Half-sister with Father as Common Parent
description_en: A female sibling who shares the genetic makeup inherited from only the biological father.
description_code: Half-sister with Father as Common Parent

description_en: A male relative who is the biological father of the biological father.
A female grandchild.
A daughter of your brother or sister.
A parent of one's paternal grandparent.

value_en: Half-sister with Mother as Common Parent
description_en: A female sibling who shares the genetic makeup inherited from only the biological mother.
description_code: Half-sister with Mother as Common Parent

description_en: A female full sibling that developed from a separately fertilized ova during the same pregnancy.
A child of one's first cousin who is related by lineage through the father's side of the family.
The aunt of one's mother.
A male relative who is a sibling of the biological mother, and who both share a common ancestor.
Someone from whom you are descended (but usually more remote than a grandparent).
A child of one's first cousin who is related by lineage through the mother's side of the family.
The aunt of one's father.
A female who contributes to the genetic makeup of her offspring from the fertilization of her ovum.
Information is not available at this time (with no expectation regarding whether it will or will not be available in the future).
Information is not available at this time but it is expected that it will be available later.
This information has not been sought. (e.g., patient was not asked)
An actual value may exist, but it must be derived from the provided information (usually an EXPR generic data type extension will be used to convey the derivation expression .
A proper value is applicable, but not known.
The content is greater than zero, but too small to be quantified.

The actual value is not a member of the set of permitted data values in the constrained value domain of a variable.The actual value is not a member of the set of permitted data values in the constrained value domain of a variable. (e.g., concept not provided by required code system).

There is information on this item available but it has not been provided by the sender due to security, privacy or other reasons. There may be an alternate mechanism for gaining access to this information.
Negative infinity of numbers.

The specific quantity is not known, but is known to be non-zero and is not specified because it makes up the bulk of the material. e.g. 'Add 10mg of ingredient X, 50mg of ingredient Y, and sufficient quantity of water to 100mL.' The null flavor would be used to express the quantity of water.
The actual value has not yet been encoded within the approved value domain.
The value as represented in the instance is not a member of the set of permitted data values in the constrained value domain of a variable.

The value is exceptional (missing, omitted, incomplete, improper). No information as to the reason for being an exceptional value is provided. This is the most general exceptional value. It is also the default exceptional value.
Known to have no proper value (e.g., last menstrual period for a male).
Positive infinity of numbers.
Information was sought but not found (e.g., patient was asked but didn't know)
